review: It's good.  Good enough to come back for your gourmet pizza fix.  The kids like it, so that will guarrantee a return visit.  I recommend the Sicilian pizza.

3 stars, +1 more for the excellent customer service from Manuel. You already know what you're going to get from CPK when you come here. My gf and I decided to try something different, she went with the Chile blah blah I don't even remember what it's called but I went with the sun dried pasta penne cream thing. The Chile thing was different, but it was good! Something I've never had before. My penne pasta was ok at BEST. Ordered chicken with it ($3 more ok no big deal right? Except, I counted like 7 TINY pieces of chicken. That coupled with a mediocre sized plate of pasta = I'm still hungry). My GF loves the mango/strawberry-iced-teas but our server mixed and matched them to perfection. He frequented our table and was always making sure we were satisfied with everything (I wasn't with the food but his exceptional service was a difference maker). Honestly, I can cook the pastas and the pizzas at home for far less than what CPK charges. However, the service here is fantastic, thanks to Manuel. Real cool, down to earth dude. Hopefully all the other wait staff is just as attentive and caring as he is.  It's been a while since I tipped +30%. Well deserved.
CPK west covina has awesome service!! great food!!

I got the BBQ chicken pizza and tried their fettucini alfredo. Both were absolutely delicious. Our server was prompt, filled up my friend's drink quickly as he had a spicy dish, and was accommodating to a small child we had with us as well. (Thanks, Gio!) BOTTOM LINE: It was a nice, casual dinner. Definitely one of the best CPKs I've been to.

mmm.. 3.3 stars?? Came here a couple nights ago with a friend to catch up over some dinner. We got there at about 830 pm ish. (I ended up eating a little before getting there so I didn't order anything.) It was my friend's first time so I was really excited to have her try some of my favorite dishes... so much for that!! Looks like CPK is undergoing some changes with their menu.. my beloved cranberry walnut chicken salad sandwich is no longer available along with a couple other dishes! ): DEEEVVASSSTATTTIONNNN! boo. Our server, Eric, was very informative, funny, and patient with us. I guess he's been with the company for about five years now? he gave us the whole run down of the menu as to what was more popular and which ones he preferred. I would totalllly hire him I had a restaurant. just saying! Anyways, it took them a while to take our order this time around too ): My friend was STARVING! and it was funny cause we were joking that Eric could've put my friend's baby in danger! (she's prego :D ) but Eric was a really good sport about it. He kept us laughing and smiling the whole time. We ended up ordering the spinach artichoke dip and the california club pizza. Their dip just doesn't seem to come out as hot as I'd like it... everrr. But it was creamy and not too heavy. My friend liked it, lots. The california club pizza looked amazinggggg! I've had it before but I didn't have any this time around since I ate already. It comes topped with avocado, and shredded lettuce. Let's just say I got a thumbs up from m'friend (: yay! The score remains at 3 stars and the only reason why I even bothered mentioning the 0.3 is because of Eric's capability to dissect each and every dish we talked about as well as making us laugh.  It seems that service is one of this location's weak points.. I think I'll stick to the CPK in Arcadia ): sorrryyy!
The spot is conveniently located and the service is great.  They have a great selection of salads and even better free bread.  If u like oil and vinegar, you have to ask for it.

this is my place to go on a Friday night. Me and my best friend have been going for a couple months now. its so bad they know us by name and have our seats saved. We didn't even have to order, they already knew! food is delicious. when i fist was going it was peperoni pizza and these macaroni things that are BOMB...but also extremely against my diet hahaha! so then i tried the grilled chick Caesar sandwich is even better! and one night i was confused on what to order and my favorite waiter suggested the avacado egg rolls ( and i looked confused like i had never had them before my friend said you have had them at Bj's ) so i ordered them.......and wow just wow! so now i am hooked!  & when i was drinking, their drink were delicious and strong. Great friendly staff! one of the managers is the best! especially on my birthday :D

This location I found out changed their menu for the worst.  They removed some of their best dishes (i.e. sauteed slamon with grilled asperagus and delicious lemon caper spaghettini, and the awsome baby clams spaghetti plus others) and surely because they are focusing exclusively on economics without regards to clients.  I was told that fortunatelly not all CPK's changed their menu only those that are franchises, so I have to travel further to CPK Brea, but it will be well worth it.

Didn't bring lunch again and decided again for a healthier choice. so i ordered on-line curbside pickup which was great. i didn't even have to call during my work hours i just clicked the time i needed to pick up my lunch at what i wanted and that was that, i got the CPK Cobb salad which was great. the service was perfect i parked my car at the parking spots of curbside service waited 2mins and BAM they brought my food out to my car. i placed my order on-line around 11:50am and i set pick up time around 1pm. i will be ordering again if i don't bring my lunch it was perfect. plus the salad was good like always CPK has great food from pizza's to salads to sandwich's. Forgot to take a picture but i bet you can tell through my words it was great.

If i could give zero stars i would-the food i ate was good but unfortunately accompanied by horrible service. Waiter forgot to place my order and when he only brought three plates out i asked if there was a fourth entree and was i told I REPEATED THE ORDER FOR YOU..as if it was my fault-he mumbled everything so i couldnt even tell you if he got it right or not but definitely not couteous at all.  Then while serving water he wanted to suddenly be funny  and told me "no water for you" it was inappropriate.  Waiters name is Luis and he should be ashamed of his srvice!!!

ive always been a fan of cpk. how ever i was very sad to see alot of my favorite dishes/pizza were no longer on the menu. bread was available upon request but they were out. the food was just not up to par. our server was really nice which was good. but i dont think i would be going back there any time soon

It was more of a 2.5, but I'll be nice today.  This location switched to the new menu once the new year started; my family and I have been avoiding this location for that very reason (Hello?!!!  This girl needs her Pan-Sauteed Salmon with Spaghettini in Lemon Caper Sauce.).  Yet today, for reasons unknown, my mom and I found ourselves in the very location that took away our one true fishy-and-lemon-zesty love. The food was okay.  Half-sized portions of the salads were very generous, and the pasta was decent.  However, my little gripe about today's visit was our waiter--Luis.  He was not very attentive.  He didn't offer us any refills until the end... when he handed us our bill.  -___- Didn't ask us if we wanted dessert.  I asked for Parmesan cheese right when he brought out our food, but somehow I didn't get it until 10 minutes late... He was nice when we he first greeted and seated us, but that quickly dissipated.  He just seemed to be off in his own lala-land.  It wasn't awful service, but it was enough to annoy me to want to Yelp about it. More than likely, I'll be hitting up my regular CPK in Brea before going back to the West Co. location.

Was at a catered business lunch in Covina and the food was served by CPK . I tried The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped it comes with Sweet corn, black beans, jicama, cilantro, basil, tortilla strips and Monterey Jack tossed in homemade herb ranch dressing. Topped with BBQ chicken, tomatoes, scallions and Avocado tortilla strips. This is a very tasty salad. I had lemonade as a drink and felt energetic after this meal. If you eat bread you get drowsy after the meal. The bread ferments and produces alcohol in your intestine causing drowsiness. Everyone enjoyed the simple lunch.  It was also a birthday party and a birthday cake was served, to avoid any extra calories nearly everyone avoided this. Americans are becoming health conscious thanks to God.

pizza was just plain bland, talk about bread and meat only. What happen to the pasta sauce? artichoke dip was decent, drink was meh. The place was nice and clean, if only the food back up the appearance as well. Price was pretty ridiculous as well.
Food was great, I like the pizza and the caramelize peach salad. It so delicious. Service was good and it was quiet when we had dinner there.

I decided to order my favorite pizza and salad to go from the CPK in Covina.  While I was waiting for my food I saw a waitress sneeze in her hands and then put her hands into the container to grab a lemon slice for an iced tea.  She did not wash her hands after she sneezed into them before she grabbed the lemon slice!  I was shocked!  She didn't even care that her hands were full of her germs and she was touching the lemon and then dropping it into the drink.  I was very happy I didn't eat at the restaurant that day.  I have to say though I'm worried about the other waiters and cooks at this restaurant.  They should have a negative star for this!!!!!

Did you notice this place has CLOSED.  Not surpised Food was OK    BUT I went to the ladies room and there was only toilet paper  in 1 of 3 stalls.  Each stall had double holders and they were empty except one stall which were almost out.    A lady came in with her son and I told her that there was no paper.  She sent her son into the men's room and told a waitress that the ladies room needed paper.    A couple more ladies came in and when I said there was no TP they just used paper towels. ("Its their own fault if the toilets get stopped up").  I waited took care of business in the stall that had paper, washed my  hands and went out and asked where the paper was?   The waitress just shrugged her shoulder and said they are working on it, didn't seem to care in the least.   I found the manager and asked him if he knew about the situation and he said yes and that the Hostess (Male) at the door was going to bring some in but people kept on coming in.    WHAT ???  The manager was just walking around, do you think he could have stepped in at the front door .....   NO   I guess it was below his level.  Finally I took the paper out of the hostesses hand and gave it to the ladies in the restroom.   They were very appreciative.    If both rolls were out, in 2 almost 3 stalls, when was the last time anyone was in there to check out things   Not only that, but the soap dispenser was running low too.    DISGUSTING!!
Try the habanero carnitas pizza with the salsa in the side. It's very good.

So glad that they are vegan friendly!  Not that there are a lot of choices but the staff is willing to help find a few great options to try.  Two of my favorites are the quinoa and arugula salad or the grilled vegetable salad

hmm .. im a fan of cpk but the day that i went both mine and my friends pasta was extremely undercooked. i also asked for my pasta to be extra saucey because often the tequila fettucine comes out dry but it was still dry so i had to ask my server for extra sauce. the service was very good. my server refilled our drinks promptly and she also was very cheerful which made the experience much better.

I used to love CPK back in the days.  Haven't been to this food chain for maybe a year or 2.  Their thai salad was the bomb! Now they totally changed the peanut sauce with some weird tasting one.  No bueno.  Plus, the server won't give you bread unless you ask for it where as in back in the days, they used to always serve you bread with butter.  Why? Third, the only good thing about this place are the 3 different kind of rolled tortillas, still the best dish in the whole restaurant.

This is an amazing place to eat lunch on their outside covered patio on a nice day. The chicken piccata is so tender and tasty and the white bean humus with flat bread is incredible. The best sandwich is the chicken caesar on garlic cheese focaccia bread. I always get top notch service from the staff at this location in West Covina which makes this my favorite CPK in Southern California.

Tried a newer menu option. A quinoa lemon salad. It was huge and tasty. The staff were gracious and kind, as well as really knowledgable of their alcohol offerings. A PLUS!!!  Appetizer of lettuce wraps was very good and quite filling. Pretty decor and pleasant ambience made this A good dinner experience.

Excellent service and consistent food quality.  My favorite is still the Thai chicken pizza.  The iced tea was rather bland.  The waitress was quick to get my orders and served them promptly.  Still a pricey place to eat for a quick lunch for half ceasar salad, Thai chicken pizza, and iced tea costing $24 total.  You are paying for the envrionment too.  :)

Im not going to write about the food. It is standard fare and some like it some dont.  I want to make a comment specifically about the service. In one word...terrible. We went on a Wednesday evening and it was predictably a slow night. So you would think that the service would be pretty quick, especially with so many servers standing around.  Our server was plain lazy. Every time we asked for something, we politely waited...and waited...and waited some more. On more than one occasion I had to get up and walk over to the server area and make a second request. Overall unacceptable. I know this isn't a gourmet restaurant or anything, but I still expect a minimum level of service.

We waited a long time before a sever came to take our order and waited even longer for our food.  Our food did not come when the customers came later than us had almost finished their food.  We asked a staff to check our order and she pointed at one of the tables and indicated that they were filling a big order.  We turned around and saw the biggest table had 6 people seated (not exactly our idea of a big order).  The food did not come quickly after we had the staff checked on our order (it appeared to us that they had not even start to prepare our orders). When the food finally came, both of what we ordered were prepared wrong.  The sever came multiple times within a very short time frame to check if we were okay with the food after corrections.  We understood that she wanted to make up, but she really was checking on us way too frequently.  She even took away one of our forks along with an empty plate when we were still working on our food. After we got the bill, we left the credit card with the bill and waited for the server to pick up and charge it.  It took such a long time that we did not want to waste our time anymore; we left cash on the table and got out.
I must say Rudy our server did an Awesome last night. Vary personable.
BBQ chicken salad is delicious.  I always love coming here all the food is good and the atmosphere is very nice

I don't know why I keep going back...  It's probably because the food is good...when they actually get your order right!  I've done "curb side" pick up 2 times and both times I've had issues! The first time, I realized they forgot my salad once I got home. rrr!  The second time, I was told my order would be ready in 10 minutes. I arrived in exactly 10 minutes and was told my order was almost ready. 10 minutes later and they still did not have my order ready! The most puzzling part is that I had only ordered a salad! My third experience: I bought a $25 gift card for my mom. When she tried to use it a few weeks later, she was told there was no $ on that card, they could not do anything about it, and she had to call a 1-800 number to see if they could help her. RRR!

Out of location convenience, we came here on a Sunday morning so we did not check the reviews prior to dining in. There was no wait as mentioned in a few reviews but I do have to say that this establishment is quite dirty. The menus had greasy fingerprints, crumbs on the tables (even though that they had just opened their doors a few moments ago at 11 am), and a dirty restroom.  Used a coupon for a free artichoke dip with $10 minimum purchase. My pizza go to order is always the California Club Pizza with honey wheat dough. Though I normally do not order appetizers but the avocado egg rolls are always awesome!  Price-wise, I still consider CPK's pizzas to be quite expensive for the portion but truthfully, it can be deceiving as well. Even with the size, we were quite full and even had leftovers.  Service was good, nothing extraordinarily special but the server was really attentive. Also registered their new dough card but since I was already using a coupon, I could not redeem my free small plate. The dough card email mentioned that the store would give us an actual card but this location did not, or maybe they did not have it yet. Overall, I would not come back except for location convenience.
When we ordered a pepperoni pizza we expected it to be at least a great size. But it was so small, I was upset.  If u get pizza don't share it, unless u don't have a big appetite

Follow Up: After waiting a couple of weeks and calling to talk to multiple "managers"; CPK finally credited my account for the missing salad.  So what is the lesson here, THEY F you in the Drive-Thru. So either eat at the location or make sure you double check that you get what you pay for.  As for me, I will take my business else where, the "manager" from the get-go could have handled the situation differently and owned up to their mistake and not treated me as someone who was trying to get a Free salad but a valued client who routinely ate at CPK. Since then, I have taken my business elsewhere.

I came here for lunch with my mom, and I realized that this location was a lot nicer then the Arcadia one. Their place setting was displayed a lot nicer. Our server was very attentive and always checking in on us. We ordered the WALDORF CHICKEN SALAD and the MARGARITA PIZZA, and they were both really good. I think if i decide to come back to CPK I would come back to this location. ENJOY!

I will start off with a positive note: roasted veggie salad is always good and California club pizza was alright, nothing special. Now, the negative side: the sever Tiffany was going through the emotion, could've been more friendly. Overall experience, the food is always great but service needs improvement.

For being six years since I've been here, the gentleman man that took our order was awesome..! He gave us some tea while we waited for our order. Plus, was patient with me while I took their original pizza and made it the way I wanted.. If you order here to go, ask or look for Will..

Cocktails are delish.. BBQ chicken pizza is my fav.. Their appetizer menu is tasty and inexpensive.. The only negative thing about this place is the service, they are under staffed and if you need service you literally have to flag someone down.

Enjoyed the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza. It was pretty yummy. We ended up getting a second pizza to go, I believe it was some meaty one. Dont remember the name, but it was good too. It definately lives up to its name California Pizza Kitchen.

I dined here once, but I normally order online and pick-up.... I love having the option of ordering online, it's so convenient! I've never had an issue, there is ample parking, no waiting, my order has been correct, and they even throw in some bread and butter.

The Bartender here is really nice and made some good drinks. Highly recommend the Waldrof chicken salad and thier Sangria. A little pricey for pizza but overall good if you like thin crust and gluten free options.

If your coming here, I would recommend you stay away from anything that isn't pizza or pasta! We ordered the focaccia which wasn't very good to start off with and be chicken lettuce wraps were not good either..honestly tastes like the costco chicken lettuce wraps...except I think costcos is better. However my thin crisp artichoke pizza was pretty good. Service was pretty solid as well. Overall good experience but food is mediocre and probably wouldn't come back

I love CPK. They have great salads and pizzas. Pretty much had all of their salads and I have to say I am impressed how good they are. Both presentation and flavors are always spot on. The pizzas are very good too for a chain place. The wild mushroom one is on the top of my list (make sure to add truffle oil). Overall I love going to CPK.

If you look at all the recent reviews, you'll see that CPK is going down hill. I used to LOVE coming here a few years ago, but this past week's lackluster experience ruined years of being a happy patron for me. First off, the food. The food is what makes up 75% of a rating, and I must say I was sorely disappointed. We tried the spaghetti bolognese (pretty basic, so should be easy right?) and overall the dish was pretty plain. To begin with, there wasn't enough sauce for all of the noodles, but then again the sauce itself didn't have a very strong flavor to it, so I'm not it would have made a huge difference anyway. We also had the wild mushroom pizza. Taste-wise this dish was okay. The most disappointing thing is that the dish was cold. Finally, the nail in the coffin was the service, or lack thereof. Our server was inattentive and though we asked for a refill of lemonade twice, the refill wasn't given to us until after she gave us the check. 2 stars for CPK. If it weren't for the giftcard we used I'd probably be even more irked. We will most likely not be back. Sad sad days.

I went here for dinner with my boyfriend. The host didn't seem like he wanted to be there. He was going to seat us near a huge, loud birthday party (maybe 14 people), when there were tons of other empty tables everywhere else. We requested a different, quieter spot, and then sat at the table we picked. We had two different waiters. Our second waiter took his time getting our order in. We ordered something to go, and he placed the order. About fifteen minutes later, I see him folding pizza boxes on the other side of the restaurant. He did this for about 9 minutes. He brought our to-go pizza and it was the wrong pizza we ordered. So we sent it back, and got our correct pizza. If the people who work here were more people-oriented and seemed like they like working there, I think it would be a better place. I think the waiters and hosts don't really care that much about what the customers want! Not going back there. Also, everything is over-priced. $12 for a salad? We got one salad, two pizzas, and one beer. The total was about 60 dollars. You would think that when the food is that expensive, the service would be over the top, really nice. Not here. I'd rather go to Pizza Port in San Diego: 2 beers, 2 pizzas for about 40 bucks.
Do not order curbside.... Waited for a long time to find out that our order was not placed....

The night of Valentines which is just another Friday night dinner night for us was I guess a better night than usual. The service and additional selections were a plus. Why can't this be every night?! Early dinner advantage-parking up front, no wait, prime seating. It's still considered Winter but the 89 degree temps made for a comfortable night to dine out in the patio.  We were given the special pre fixe menu and the regular menu. The pre fix was such a deal with an appetizer 2 entrees and a dessert for only $30. Unfortunately, we came in with predetermined options in our head and that was it. Starter was the steamed dumplings that stands great on its own. Can be filling if you eat all of it yourself. I haven't had the tequila lime chicken fettuccine in years. One of my favorite dishes that reminds me of the old and now defunct Crocodile Cafe in Pasadena. I asked to go light on the cream, so my chicken and pasta are not drowning in sauce.  I guess tequila is just part of the name now because I don't taste the tequila just the lime. It's all good though-yummy nonetheless. The chimichurri chicken and vegetables were a welcomed change for the palette. I had to reach with my fork for a taste. Perfectly cooked chicken and grilled veggies were fresh.  The chimichurri sauce was as green as pesto with a slight punch of heat.  Great food and service made for an even greater not so Valentine, Valentines night dinner.
I mean the service is not bad but they could be more friendly! Pasta was dry and I felt like the were rushing me to leave.
The food was OK nothing special. The one complaint is that they need to wash the dishes better. The bread plates we got still had stuff from the last customers gross.
Great service. Great pizza. Great vibe.  If you like spicy food order the habenero carnitaa.  Recommendation is to sit at the bar if you want super duper service.
best customer service & great bartending skills ..... love the citrus adobo margarita  ask for will he is great.

I give three stars for the service. Our waitress was friendly and on top of the refills. I give one star for food and cleanliness. The table was dirty as well as the bread plates. My pizza was soggy and my daughters spaghetti and bolognese (?) sauce was very oily.  The place was better when it first opened.

Haven't been here in 3 year's. . It's a nice clean roomy restaurant. Delicious cocktails, pizza and pasta. . Nice for a Saturday afternoon meal. I had the sparagus, spinach and shrimp spaghettini, it was delicious. For dessert the chocolate souffle and strawberry shortcake. .

I came during father's day (forgot it was fathers day) my party was a party of 15 and we waited about 1 hr to be accommodated. Not only that but by the time we were seated there were not many customers, so the waiter took time to get our drinks. The food and drinks are great, service is a little slow. If they pick it up this will be a 4 star.

Made my return to CPK on Thursday 6/19/14,arrived around 3:20pm had made an early dinner date with GF being that she works at the mall and was off at 3:30 I had ordered ahead of time.Started with the half order of the Roasted Veggie Salad to share,requested that the Roasted Artichoke+Spinach Thin Crust be prepared at 3:35 that way GF would arrive and the pizza would be warm. Manny was a class act,very attentive always had me a fresh Mango Tea ready.Around 4pm Manny comes by sees the pizza and I sitting there and no GF. Manny asked to put the pizza in the warmer,sure I say.Still no GF or phone call,4:10pm GF phone call,still working lost track of time,Praise God.Manny brings me my 3rd Mango Tea and order GF's Mango Tea.The female manager stops by and says oh no let us prepare a fresh pizza.GF arrives and everything is Blessed!If I could give 10 stars I would, CPK's staff,female manager,and Manny.... Thank You all. The food,service,and Strawberry Shortcake the Best,God's Blessings to you all.See you next week.

Came in on a Saturday, it was kinda busy, but our server was so great!! His name was Gabe and he was sooooo helpful. We had the tequila fettuccine and the BBQ chicken pizza, both great, but our service was the best. Honestly the best service I've had in a while. He was so helpful and brought out refills without us having to ask. He was so nice too, it was refreshing!!! I love this CPK!
1st time eating here! Our waiter Omar was not very attentive - the food was excellent! We got the Cobb salad and a pizza w/ the works! The price wasn't too bad either!

Outstanding service!! Peter is such a awesome waiter! Couldn't have had a better service today. Food was great, wasn't that hungry so I ordered the crispy Mac n cheese.. Let me tell you, they look like chicken nuggets lol but taste delicious. Also they are closing this cpk. Bummer!!!!! Thank you Peter for your great service!
Great service. Omar was our waiter and convinced us to get dessert (rare for my wife and I). It was pretty busy and we didn't have to wait long for our drinks and food.

Its closing soon!!! I was here on Thursday 7/17 and we were informed they will closing this CPK...they are actually tearing down the whole little area here to make room for the 10 freeway carpool lane..Im really bummed, we love coming here and sit in the bar area..great service, food and atmosphere! Manny the bartender is awesome! I'll miss coming here...anyways i tried the Chile relleno from the lite menu, its really good and filling! Not bad for 400 calories!!!

Ate here for lunch yesterday and had the bbq chicken pizza. It was really good and I was surprised I ate the whole thing! The bread they give you with the vinaigrette sauce is really good too. Our waitress was on top of her game. Right when my drink was running low, she had a fresh one out for me. Sad to hear this cpk is closing down for freeway construction

This place is sweet but come sunday they close their doors. Building being knocked down for additional roads for buses. This is grade A crap. Just when I find a bad a$$ place to eat they want to knock it down.

The last meal at this location it will soon be knocked down .... It's been fun ..April the manager was amazing extremely friendly always making me feel welcomed I'll miss her service for sure. So long cpk it's been fun .. But I'm moving..
My favorite location. ..it's closing today...we had our last lunch this afternoon. ..April is the best. .so sad . But they promised they will open close by soon.
Just visited this location and it is closed. Even the signage outside is gone.  Too bad.....
Here one day and gone the next.. You will be Missed. Closed for business and it looks like Lucille's is going to be in that area.
